text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Bahraini press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Shares of the Islamic Development Bank's unit Investment Fund to be listed on the Bahrain Stock Exchange, trading to begin on Thursday.
- Trade between the United Arab Emirates and South Korea grows 25 percent in the first nine months of 1996.
- Oman's minister of state for foreign affairs says Gulf Arab states prefer brotherly solution to Qatar-Bahrain border dispute.
- Around 5.7 million tourists visited Gulf Arab states in 1995, tourism income increased to $1.8 billion.
- Bahrain demands return of a pilot and helicopter which defected to Qatar on Monday.
